Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but please replace the carpet!”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel02
Reviews.Content: Clean and well maintained Residence Inn, however it has been 8 years since construction of this hotel and although it has been well maintained, the eight year old carpet is beginning to show its age...and has that old carpet smell. Simply replacing the carpet would do wonders for this place! Some upgrades including flat screen tvs on all rooms, furniture, bedding, and wallpaper with current artwork have been added over the years. This is a popular hotel and gets a lot of use. Common areas appear to have been upgraded at some point. This hotel is within walking distance of Daytona Beach Speedway and closed to shopping and dning options. Management indicated a renovation was due next year. Looking forward to next year's stay as the staff is outstanding and this is one of my favorite Residence Inn properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: docputer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when my flight was cancelled at the last minute. The hotel came and picked me up at the airport, got me settled in my room, and made sure I found a good dinner nearby. They also had a driver standing by for my 4am trip back to the airport. Excellent service. The suite was luxurious, well furnished and was quite relaxing. I loved this hotel and the service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here as opposed to the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Clare B
Reviews.Content: I was here on business for in August 2012. I had been in the Courtyard my first night, and checked out after hearing from colleagues that the Residence Inn was better suited to our needs. For the same price as the Courtyard, I had an enormous suite, free breakfast (as opposed to the microwaved eggs the Courtyard "bistro" has) and good internet access (also something lacking at the Courtyard). The gym was small and had dated equipment. However, the pool area was nice and the rest of the property seemed recently updated. I had no issues with room cleanliness that other reviewers noted. The staff was incredibly accommodating when it came to having to change our reservations, and it was a nice stay. The next time I'm in the area I'd probably want to stay at the beach (this hotel is adjacent to the airport and speedway) but this is a well-run, nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Breanna B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was VERY nice, compared to the hotel we stayed in last year (Mayann Inn) ---> dont go there!!! The Residence inn by Marriott had a great location, next door to the Daytona Airport, and near the race track. It is literally minutes from the beach. The hotel staff was very helpful, they have a very nice breakfast buffet, ex. Waffle maker, eggs, cereal, a little bit of everything, but it changes from day to day so you get a variety. Also, they allow pets for a $75 charge which is not bad. The front desk was especially nice because we were going to Ormond beach and i had no idea of the address, and i called the front desk and they looked it up for me and gave me the address, i thought that was very nice. Overall it was a very very enjoyable stay! I recommend it to all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: SunDiego123
Reviews.Content: I couldn't decide whether to rate this Residence in 4 or 5 stars. Decided to go with the "5" because despite a few issues with housekeeping, this property and its staff went the extra mile to make things right. We stayed for 2 nights and were picked up at DAB by the Marriott's hotel shuttle. We asked Allen (the shuttle driver) if he could recommend a restaurant that we could walk to. He told us the shuttle could run us over to the nearby Marriott Courtyard restaurant or he would take us to any of the local restaurants in a 3 mile radius (free) and then just call him and he'd be back to pick us up. Nice! Checkin at the hotel was friendly and efficient. After checking into our room we called downstairs for the shuttle, so we could go to dinner. This was such a great service!! The downside to our experience at this hotel... after dinner we came back and settled into our room and found a wastebasket over-flowing with trash under the kitchen sink, plus a coffee maker with coffee & filter from the previous guest. Ick! Called the front desk and Allen came up immediately and took care of the problem ~ even brought us a brand new coffee maker. Allen really went out of his way to make our stay excellent despite the problems that were not his fault. We later received a follow-up call from the Housekeeping Supervisor which was a nice customer service touch as well. Okay, so what made this a 5-star stay? Super friendly front desk staff! Room was quiet and other than the trash problem on check-in, room was very clean. Beds were comfy with lots of pillows! Good channel selection, good wifi, great climate control. And excellent breakfast! The breakfast attendant was very hard working, the food was fresh, a good mix of healthy food and not-so healthy ;) And there were plenty of tables in 3 different sections. Free newspapers (USA Today and the local paper). Just an excellent place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl01
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 day stay at the Residence Inn. The room/suite was spacious and very clean. The breakfast was wonderful and had a nice varitey. The staff was most welcoming and very helpful. The location was nice as it was close to a mall and resturants. We were there for a quick trip and did not need beach access so the location was not important for us.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn Daytona Beach version”
Reviews.Author: FEDRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn in Daytona Beach for several days while visting a relative in Port Orange. The Inn is next to the Speedway and the Daytona Beach airport (DAB), so noise was heard from time to time but never offensive. The Inn was also was of the more recently built mid-rise Residence Inns; it has all the nice Residence Inn amenities: full kitchen, living room area, gratis breakfast in the morning, and a coin laundry just down the hall. There was some outside work going on the building while I was there, but I only noticed once in five days. A computer to check my e-mail right off the lobby, and a very helpful staff at the desk. Speedway Boulevard is a two block drive with all sorts of restaurants. I have enjoyed Residence Inns for many years since Marriott started up the chain and this was one of my better experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay Residence Inn!”
Reviews.Author: basketgal89
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved hotel. Bill at front desk is awesome. Managers reception that included delicious grilled hot dogs and hamburgers with 3 salads, chips and yummy rice krispie treats. Breakfast was equally good. Rooms were so comfy. Beach was 5 miles away but easy drive.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get any closer to the speedway!`”
Reviews.Author: GatorCrew
Reviews.Content: We didn't realize that this hotel was so close to the speedway and our kids were thrilled when they realized that they could look out their windows and see cars actually circling the track! The rooms were smaller than we expected- we had a two bedroom suite with living space. We had to move furniture around to open up the pull out couch which worked well but was hard to sit on before it pulled out because the cushions were sunken in. There is a cut out above the bathroom into the living space so there isn't complete privacy in one of the rooms. The breakfast was good, staff was pleasant and the rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Speedway”
Reviews.Author: spacecoastkim
Reviews.Content: New hotel within walking distance to the speedway. Nothing else around except restaurants and by car the beach is at least 15 to 20 minutes in traffic. Hotel offers breakfast which is nice and rooms are like a small studio apartment so it would be easy to fix meals in the room if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal customer service”
Reviews.Author: trish149
Reviews.Content: After three straight weekends in a hotel room in various cities, I stayed here for two nights during a swim meet at the Port Orange Y. I have stayed here before for the same reason and have not had any issues before. The reviews about Bill at the front desk are completely accurate. Bill was friendly, helpful and addressed all my issues to my satisfaction immediately upon check in. I was able to check in early, given a room that met my floor preference and location perfectly and he addressed some issues with the room. My biggest complaint usually with Marriot and Hilton (I am a rewards member for both) is their unwillingness to guarantee late checkout. I asked on Saturday afternoon for late checkout on Sunday and was told for sure that I could have the room until 2. That is such a huge relief when we travel for swimming, as we never know quite how long the meet will last, but hate to have to pack up the room in the morning when we have to be at a pool for 6:30am. The internet worked perfectly and the room appointments were good. This is a Residence Inn that has not been renovated recently, but it was still nice enough. I believe they are doing some renovating as I saw signs that painting was occurring. We did not eat breakfast here this time, so I cannot comment on that. Rooms, common areas all seemed lovely and inviting. We had 12 people over for dinner on Friday night and had plenty of room in the living, dining area for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!! Love this place.”
Reviews.Author: GO4FUNINTHESUN
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth (maybe sixth) year going to this hotel for two weeks during spring break. The breakfast staff, management( new), front desk-(especially Bill and Fay), our house keeper Diana, and the evening reception staff all went out of their way to make our stay fantastic. I wish I was better with names, but I rember all the friendly faces. Their excellent service has provided us with many great family memories. It's convenient to stay connected to work with WI-FI in our room allowing us to stay longer, also our daughter is able to fly in and spend 9 days with us and she can work from her laptop. The shuttle from the airport is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Late night wonders”
Reviews.Author: SLC122
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of different Marriott properties all over the country. Unfortunately, most of my flights are red-eyes so when I check in, it's usually around 12-1am. That's not when most people are chipper at all. Robbie who was working the overnight shift was as friendly as anyone I'd expect to see in the morning - MUCH friendlier than the ones who haven't had their coffee yet. He was very helpful with everything I needed and was even able to fix the issues I was having logging on to the internet. Other than that, the breakfast buffet was fantastic. It's always good to be able to get a decent quality hot breakfast in the morning and not the standard cold continental breakfast that most hotels offer. The "business center" could use a bit of an upgrade. It only has one computer/printer and if someone's on it, good luck getting them off.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again just to visit Bill at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: CW22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights for Daytona Bike Week. Bill Van Mers Bergen was the best part of our stay. He is a) HILARIOUS, b) very accommodating [kept track of a box we were shipping to and from hotel and some other requests] and c) treated us and other guests like family. I expect that from a small mom and pop boutique hotel but not from a large chain - very refreshing. The hotel was bike friendly which I liked, we were able to park the bike right outside the front doors under the awning so it wouldn't get wet. The room was spacious and clean, and I really had no noise complaints. This hotel gets an A+ for being able to open both windows in the room as far as I wanted - I hate stale air!! I liked that the hotel was kind of out of the way but still minutes from all the bike week activity - so I could leave the noise when I chose. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for bike week”
Reviews.Author: Rich V
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights while at the 2011 bike week and had a great time. The rooms were large and up to date. Since it's a Residance Inn we could make some of our meals in order to save money. The hotel is right down the street from the speedway which has the venues where a the manufacturer's have demo rides. Breakfast (included) was very good and the staff friendly and helpful. Like most Marriotts, they were bike friendly. They did raise the rates for bike week but we were able to us points to stay. The only cleanliness note was an un-emptied trash can under the sink. The rest of the room was very clean and quiet (even with all the motorcycles in town for the event). The high-speed internet was not reliable during the stay but we didn't use it much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally bad service ...”
Reviews.Author: DJ B
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks tired and well worn and could use some updating and redecorating - not up to the usual Residence Inn standards but the service was truly bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good Extended Stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Klove007
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for free at this Marriott property using night certificates earned from their frequent guest program. Overall Hotel was good, nice clean and my room looked updated. I was able to get a 2 queen suite for my 4 night stay at this hotel. Granite countertops in the bathroom and kitchen. Breakfast was good every morning had the usual extended stay fare. Hotel had a plumbing leak on our floor from one of the pipes which was being collected in a garbage bin and was only emptied once while we were there. On the 3rd day during the day they fixed the leak, but had to turn off the water for the whole hotel. They did give us notice and did make sufficient prearrangements for us to get water from the market and shower at the local courtyard if we needed. (which of course we did as we were getting ready for an evening out after spending it on the beach was approximately a 15 minute drive) Small incovience to fix the leak. It was close to restaurants and shopping malls, right next to the airport and the famous racetrack. Pool was clean and heated, but did not go in as we spent time on the beach. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: lab12345
Reviews.Content: Not close to the beach unless you have a car but great location if you do. Was quiet and calm when i went but watch out for race activities daytona 500 across the street. Cute heated pool and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Thank you, Bill”
Reviews.Author: okieginger
Reviews.Content: The front desk person, Bill was very accomodating. We greatly appreciated his assistance with our stay. Thank you! The Robinson's.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations with paper thin wall”
Reviews.Author: custerbar
Reviews.Content: I write this on my last night of a 3 night stay at this hotel. While the room itself is spacious and comfortable, I am bleary eyed having been up since 2:00 am (its 4 now) due to the party on the floor above. The walls of this hotel are so poorly constructed that you can hear whole conversations and every noise from the rooms next door, in the hall and apparently the floor above. The desk clerk was so nice & has gone up personally to ask them to be a bit quieter but they totally ignore him. So I will drive 6 hours home tomorrow with no sleep and I am miserable. My husband and I were surprised the first night we stayed at how easily you could hear people talking in the hall way and in their rooms next door. If you stay at this hotel, insist on the corner room on the top floor - that may be the only way you get any sleep here. Or bring a room fan to create some white noise. I travel for my job and in 15 years I have never stayed at a hotel that is so conducive to noise from other rooms. Whoever built it must have put paper between the plywood. The room is a nice room (although the bathroom could have used a good cleaning and mold/mildew removal) and the lobby area is beautful and the staff friendly. It is a convenient location for those visiting the speedway and is close to the airport if you fly in.

Reviews.Title: “Turkey Run Rest Stop”
Reviews.Author: L0vinFlorida
Reviews.Content: Looking for the most convenient location to stay when you want to be close to the Speedway for events? This location is within easy walking distance, exceptionally clean and comfortable. We enjoyed hot breakfasts every day before venturing out to the car show or beach. Every staff member was more than accomadating to address our needs and any questions. They clearly like their jobs. They even provided Thanksgiving dinner with all the trmmings for those guests without plans for dinner. Rooms are spacious, well stocked, comfortable beds and newer decor. Overall very pleasant experience. The single drawback...a room by the pool, as it can get quite loud in the evenings if other guests are taking advantage og the grill area adjacent to the pool and workout center. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: capitalistroader
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights this past week. Gret bed and well equippped room. PC users note: Wireless internet connection is faster than the wired one. Great for folks visitng for a car race or flying in to airport, as hotel is between those facilities-but very quiet). Great bed!

Reviews.Title: “Desk Clerk, Bill, will make you smile”
Reviews.Author: joe j
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, in October and November of 2011. In both instances, the front desk clerk, Bill, was extremely helpful and accommodating . He went out off his way to make sure that we had the room that we wanted and that we were happy. The rooms are nicely appointed, with full sized stainless steel appliances, and the beds that were super comfy. It has a nice pool, but unfortunately it does not get late afternoon sun. The only problem we had was on our second stay. The night staff did not turn down the music in the halls and t the pool at night. The manager failed to live up to the Marriott promise of "satisfaction guarantee " by only offering only 2000 bonus points .for two nights of partial loss of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been a comfortable stay with better quality control”
Reviews.Author: SolivitaJim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed one night at this hotel as a short get away trip from home. We got a good rate, and was our first stay in a Marriot chain in the last four or five years. We always had faith in this chain, and although this stay did not change our opinion, this hotel definitely needed to try harder to keep up with the Marriot image. Upfront, I must be fair to say that the room we had was clean and relatively comfortable, but there were numerous minor inconveniences that negatively impacted my rating for them. Our booking and reception at the hotel was efficient and pleasant. After entering the first room on the first (ground) floor, I immediately found out there was no signal strength whatsoever on the WiFi. I told my wife not to disturb anything in the room until I checked out the signal at other parts of the hotel. I went to the third and fifth floor and checked signals right outside the elevator and got 100% strength on each floor. I returned to the front desk and request for a change of room to the upper floors, and was very pleasantly accommodated. We got a new room on the fourth floor and had to leave right away due to running late for an obligation. When we returned after dinner at about 8 p.m., I found that the signal in this new room was also 0%. But once I stepped out in the hallway and walk towards the elevator, the signal went up to 75 to 100%. Eventually, I took my WiFi tablet to the lobby area to check e-mail, and found out (unfortunately) that although the signal strength there was good from my tablet to the router, the pipeline going from the router out to the internet was so slow that I had to give up any web surfing out of frustration. This condition was verified by another couple traveling with us whose room was right next to ours. Surprisingly, the speed improved dramatically in the morning, probably due to low usage by other guests in the hotel. Meanwhile, my wife found out that there was no tissue, no dish towel in the kitchenette, no guest information folder, and a bunch of wet dishes in the dishwasher (condition unknown). She recalled that in the first floor room that we were originally assigned, there was a guest information folder, a box of tissue, two dish towels and the dishes were neatly stacked in the cabinets. When I turned on the TV and tried to look for CNN, the single sheet of paper for channel guide was so confusing and misleading that I could not locate the station. I called the front desk and the first response was “I don’t really know because we just had a new cable provider”. She called back five minutes later and told me the number for HLN (Headline News) instead. When I insisted on CNN, she hesitantly said “10, but it did not work on our TV downstairs”. In fact, CNN on “10” worked fine in our room TV. As for the suite, it had a green sofa and a mismatched red arm chair (did not seem to be purposely put there by designed). The two TV’s, one in the sitting area and one in the bedroom, were LG’s and were very clear. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were wimpy. We were too embarrassed to ask for firmer pillows by bed time because we had already asked for too many other missing stuff. The shower handle would not shut water off completely unless it was overly tightened, and by then, the whole shower assembly became loose. The counter sink stopper would not hold water. The bottom line was: the quality control in our room was poor. The cleaning personnel should have checked and reported discrepancies to the maintenance crew to get them fixed instead of letting them go to frustrating those “one night” guests. Finally, the included breakfast was a “me too” affair – nothing worthy of special notations.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: GetMeOuttaThisTown
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my time here. Great value and a nice place to stay. Would likely be deafening if staying during racing season, but luckily this wasn't an issue. Living room furniture could be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Has been better.”
Reviews.Author: BBGRL
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at out room we found it dirty..The counters were sticky, the headboard was dirty, the couch was full of crumbs, the mirror had wet smudges, and there were mysterious spots on the bed sheets..I have stayed at this hotel before and plan to give it another try, but i was not happy at all. The breakfast was ok which includes: make your own waffles, pastries, scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausages, coffee, juices, and yogurts. There are great, spacious two bedroom suites. The staff was excellent, when we called about the room they sent someone up immediately and then the room was clean. There is a full kitchen, that is lacking in kitchen ware. Over all, i would try it again, hoping it will go back to being fantastic! There is a pool (6ft deep) and a basketball court, bbq grill with sitting area and fitness center. Its just minutes from the beach, and right next door to the international speedway. Even though the hotel is right in front of the airport, we didn't hear the planes on the second floor..I can't speak for anything above that.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room !!”
Reviews.Author: bappleton
Reviews.Content: The bed is like a marshmellow cloud - just marvelous!! I had a King bed with a kitchen. The room was great. It provided everything I needed. If I could have changed anything, it would have been to change the location to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “A lucky find for us”
Reviews.Author: MsCheap1
Reviews.Content: I should've reviewed this sooner. We happened to find this hotel while looking for another - lucky for us. We took a 2 bedroom suite intending to stay just one night but ended up staying 3. Staff was excellent, our suite was just what we needed, breakfast was very good, too. Right next to the speedway and likely a very noisy place then but we were happy to have found this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms and good location!”
Reviews.Author: thescoot
Reviews.Content: Clean and animal friendly. Very close to the speedway and many restaurants. We stayed for a USTA tennis event & to golf at the LPGA. both of which were only 10 minutes away. The beaches are about 1/2 hour. This was our 3rd trip there and would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: PQ1269
Reviews.Content: My husband was at the hotel for three weeks and my 2 yr old grand daughter and I flew in for 4 days, We stayed in a king studio. It was spacious even with a porta crib, a carriage and a floatie for the pool. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was very nice. There was scrambled eggs, yogurt, waffles, juice, fresh fruit, sausage and potatoes with all kinds of bread for toasting. It was very convenient having the kitchen in our unit to make lunch for the baby. The pool area was clean and the water was a perfect temperature. It was just a few miles to the beaches, however we stayed at the hotel because my grand daughter preferred the pool. A great time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: smetlm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, and found it to be a great hotel. There was a little problem checking in -- miscommunication between the front desk and housekeeping, and they kept sending us to rooms that hadn't been cleaned yet. However, on the third try, the room was clean, and we found it to be quite comfortable. The kitchen had decent dishes and utensils, and it's always nice to have a full-size refrigerator. Only thing of note: we used a couple of glasses, cups, and knives, rinsed them and put them in the dishwasher. The next day, when we returned, I noticed that they were all back in the drawer/cabinet. I'm pretty sure they weren't clean (there was still a small coffee spot in the bottom of one cup), but the housekeeper must have thought they were, as they had been rinsed and didn't "look" dirty. After that, I washed dishes before we used them -- just to be sure. Otherwise, the hotel was great. Breakfast was good, and the pool was nice. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: lmj86
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn was a great choice for an extended weekend getaway. Very easy to find and close to the interstate, it was very convenient. There were 3 of us and we had a one bedroom suite, it was a perfect setup because we had the living area so we had room to spread out. There is a full kitchen, minus the oven, so it was great to fix a meal if we chose not to go out. The room was spotless, everything was clean and in good working order. The daily breakfast was great, much better than most hotels free breakfast. It included eggs, sausage, potatoes, fruit, yogurt, bagels, etc. The biggest drawback was a small pool, given the size of the hotel it could have been bigger. Also, if your going to the beach it is a short drive, nothing too bad but still a hike none the less. There are a million different restaurants within a mile or two in each direction so finding something to eat nearby is easy to do. If you need more space, this is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Meets My Needs - At A Great Price”
Reviews.Author: fldave
Reviews.Content: First, this is next to the Daytona Speedway yet fairly central for those visiting friends or other Daytona attractions. I was visiting family for Thanksgiving and was assigned the task of making both the mashed potatoes and the gravy for 35 for diner. So I needed a suite that had enough working space in the kitchen along with two bedrooms and this R.I. Marriott fit the bill quite nicely. The bed rooms were large as was the living room/kitchen space. I searched all the sites for hotels and found a great rate at a nearby comparable hotel , called this hotel directly and they matched the rate!!! Nothing fancy yet my needs were met without a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to take the family!”
Reviews.Author: luvs2go4trip
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel every spring for the last 4 years. We usually stay 10-14 days. We always have enjoyed our stay here, but this year was by far the best time we have ever had. We traveled with our children and grand children. The room was always clean and well supplied. Some days we did not need maid service, but they were very prompt at getting us what few things we needed. The pool was nice and warm which made it very enjoyable for everyone. There was a problem with the hot tub and we missed being able to use it, but I am sure that it is fixed by now. The breakfast was great! It has a big variety for everyone. The breakfast staff did a super job and are so friendly and helpful. We also enjoyed the Thursday night BBQ. It is fun meeting all the other hotel guests and socializing with them at the get togethers the hotel has for the guests. The dinner/social staff prepared delicious food/snacks for these events. Bill, at the front desk, is so nice and has a wonderful sense of humor. He also has a wealth of imformation about the area which is helpful for us travelers. Everyone that worked there was always kind, friendly and helpful. Stay here and you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn saved us”
Reviews.Author: BFMcLaughlin
Reviews.Content: So horrible weather swept through the Daytona area, and our neighborhood once again lost power. In the past we would have just thrown our hands up and said "who cares" but with twin 1-year olds we decided it would be easier to just hit a local hotel for the night. Obviously this stay was totally unplanned. My wife called the Residence Inn and got a business discount through work. So obviously the price was right. But what amazed me was how awesome the staff was. The lady at the front desk was sympathetic and immediately put us on 2 p.m. checkout the next day because of our situation. She said "take the time if you need it, we'll be OK". Then she spent 5-10 minutes online trying to print out menus so we could get some takeout in the room. She didn't have to do that. The next morning, I'm trying to get our twins into the van by myself, and it's still pouring on my head and I was in a huge rush to get back home and the manager himself helped me get them in there without the kids getting drenched. Not only awesome staff, just really good human beings. Now, we may not get a chance to stay at the Residence all the time because we live locally, but they will be the ONLY place that gets our business if A) the weather does that to us again and B) we have family in town. We will recommend this place until rapture.....it's a new property and it's very well run. The free breakfast was outstanding with plenty of space to sit. We got a two-room suite and the room was clean to the "T" with plenty of room to space out. Had a fridge, oven, microwave -- everything you'd expect at a place like this. We walked away QUITE impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Residence Inn stay!”
Reviews.Author: Upnorthfan
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Daytona 500 and couldn't have chosen a better spot!! Just a few short weeks before we were traveling to Daytona, I checked the website and found they had an opening. How lucky we were!! We got a two bedroom suite and it couldn't have been better. The track was only a block away and our suite overlooked it. We were thrilled!! It was very clean and the service was fantastic. The food served for breakfast and the BBQ was great. The pool was warm and felt great on a cool evening. I can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, few maintenance issues but resolved quickly”
Reviews.Author: Kathrine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an extended period of time for family function. It is literally at the end of the Daytona Beach airport property and also convenient to Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University. You must drive to the beach which is about 6 miles away. Upon arrival we were given a studio room on the 5th floor. We opened the curtain to the only window in the room to stare at the corner of the building and therefore had a very limited view of anything. Disappointing at best. We called the front desk and were given another room on 5th floor. This room (studio) had 2 windows which was nice and looked out on the airport side of the hotel over the pool. The only thing immediately noticeable was the amount of dust on the tables, desk and return duct. It looked as though this room hadn't been used for a while - so we just ran a towel over things and cleaned it up. Not a big deal. After purchasing a few groceries, we put them in the refrigerator. The fan kicked on and wow - it was noisy. We tried to run the garbage disposal only to have it not run and the sink back up. My husband turned on the sink in the bathroom and the entire faucet came off in his hand! There was no way we were going to tolerate these inconveniences the entire time, so I went down the to front desk to report the problem. The front desk clerk put in a request for maintenance the next day. The next day, upon returning to the room in the early afternoon, we discovered no maintenance on the items had been completed. I went to the front desk to ask when someone might be coming. The desk clerk (a different person) had no record that maintenance was to come to our room at all. He put in a telehone call and had someone to our room within a half hour. The maintenance person, Cliff, who worked at the Courtyard down the street is to be commended as a dedicated Marriott employee. He was kind, considerate and extremely conscientious about his work. He had all 3 items resolved quickly. He showed pride in his work and we are hoping this note gets back to him and his supervisor. The breakfast area was clean and well-stocked. There are a variety of food choices which is great. We didn't use the pool this trip, but have on past trips and it is nice and clean. Parking is well lit and plentiful. Overall, this is a nice hotel - mostly thanks to people like Cliff who take care of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service even when put in a difficult situation”
Reviews.Author: gm03us
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveler, and often stay at Residence Inn. Most reputable hotels have decent service on a regular basis. The real test, however, is how they handle an abnormal situation i.e. things they cannot control, particularly other guests. In my case, it was a very noisy dog in the middle of the night. All regular travelers from time to time have had the unpleasant experience of a noisy or otherwise unpleasant neighbor in a hotel. Generally, in my own experience, hotels do little or noting about it. Sure, they may offer another room. But at 2 a.m. this is not such an appeasing option. Yet, the management handled the situation with class and did the only thing they could do, compensated me for the stay. It was the right thing to do from a management perspective, as I booked another stay at a Residence Inn the same day, and will be staying at this hotel again in the future. Otherwise, this hotel is what you expect from a Residence Inn. The room is apartment-like at an excellent price. It was very clean and they followed my prior instructions for extra pillows and coffee (the small things make all the difference!), as well as early check-in. The hot tub was also clean. The sports area is also a nice amenity; I used the mini-tennis court to let off a little steam. All in all, an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: 101110c
Reviews.Content: We stopped here late one evening and secured a 2 bedroom suite. I'm sure this is a noisy place during race week since it's right next to the track, but for us it was wonderfully clean, comfortable and quiet. After seeing our choices on the oceanfront in Daytona, we went back to this hotel for 2 more nights. We're picky about where we stay, but would recommend this hotel to anyone. Only negative to us is that they allow dogs, and we heard some barking on the ground floor - luckily, not near our room up top!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: tnsnut
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. I chose it for my family members who were attending a wedding in Daytona. At first I had concerns about its proxemity to the airport but there was absolutely no noise in the evening from aircraft. The rooms are large, clean and very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful. Full breakfast was provided each morning. This will be the hotel I stay in on subsequent visits to Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & restful”
Reviews.Author: TrvlngMomFl
Reviews.Content: The best part is the sincerely welcoming, helpful, and courteous staff- frontdesk, breakfast, handymen, roommaids. I left my cellphone charger behind in the room when we left, called the next day, they found it and mailed it to me so I had it in 2days. Pool large and clean, towels provided; could even do some laps. Rooms & kitchen are spacious and comfortable, quiet, with wonderful beds. Great fullsize refrig, but icemaker too noisy so had to turn it off at night (kitchen staff gladly filled my cooler with ice instead). We had insufficient room cooling in first few hours (windows faced southwest), which was repaired immediately upon request when we went out for dinner. Gave only 2 stars for cleanliness (room 517) because there was trail of teensy ants on the bathroom wall going to a rusty ceiling patch, and moldy dust in bathroom vent.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: southernbell1014
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 6 persons going to the Daytona 500 this February 2010. We booked our rooms 9 months in advance so we could stay right behind the track and got a really good rate. The day before we were leaving to travel to Florida from North Carolina, a lady from this hotel called us and told us they had overbooked their hotel and we had been moved to another location 6 miles away in Port Orange. This was very upsetting to us considering we had been looking forward to this vacation for almost a year. The lady assured us we would have 2 suites with 1 queen bed and a pull out slepper sofa in our new facility. We also would be allowed to park at the Residence Inn for the race and would receive 1 nights stay for free. We were also allowed to eat breakfast at the Residence Inn since they had hot bar. When we arrived on Friday at the Residence Inn (following instructions given) to recieve our parking passes, the lady that had called us was off until Monday (the day we were leaving). Upon arrival at the other hotel 6 miles away we checked in and unloaded our cars and went to our rooms. We had 1 king bed in each room. Understand we had 3 adults per room. When we asked for rollaway beds, they had none. Residence Inn however did bring us blow up mattress for our rooms. So a vacation that had been planned for 9 months resulted in one adult per room sleeping on a blow up mattress for three nights. We feel the Residence Inn moved us because we had such a reasonable rate and they could get much more per night closer to the beginning of the Daytona 500. Is that really FAIR to people who reserve rooms way in advance to make sure they have the rooms they prefer? What good are reservations?????

Reviews.Title: “Managment cannot handle guest relations problems & Hotel security/safety poor”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ1996
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel directly across from the Daytona Speedway for 1 week. Hotel has a supposedly SMOKE-FREE POLICY which is not enforced by hotel. We complained about guests smoking on our floor (smell in our hallway was very bad) & got told if we can't actually catch them smoking we can't do anything about it. And this went on for 2 days. During our stay, the hotel had a group of guests 2 tour bus loads (mostly young football players & cheer leaders ages 12-14) plus & parents/chaperons with them arrive on our 3rd night there. Hotel allowed these guests to be running through hallways, slamming doors including the fire escape doors, bouncing balls in rooms & hallways, opening the glass fire extingusher locked doors, wrote on walls in stairways, threw soda cans & paper wrappers on fire escape stairs (if there would have been a real emergency in this hotel & guests needed to use these stairs would have been in danger with all this trash on them) and these activities went on all night long even still at 5:00 A.M. bouncing balls above your bedroom. We complained & hotel staff didn't care. Back entrance door to hotel would standing wide for who knows how long at different times. This group on our last day of the 7 days there was finally told they had to leave the hotel. We were there for an event at the Speedway during this period & in the morning from the room window you can watch people (not Hotel guests) park there vehicles across the street in parking area for the event & walk over into the hotel for what is supposedly the guests breakfast & hotel allows non-guests to use the hotel parking lot. Upon checking no vehicles are registered at the time. Front desk staff cannot make decisions on what to do for guest relations problems. They need to contact a hotel manager who is not there at the hotel. A problem needs to go from one manager to another, no one has the authorithy to do any corrections with your bill. After on second day back home we heard from a so-called manager, whom could not do anything about our complaints & they needed to pass it along to another person. Hotel managment will not give you actual credit compensation on your bill for any inconviences such as we endured during this stay. Only after disputing with the credit card company, did we receive a letter from managment giving us these 2 certificates, which is not what we asked for. With an experience like this why would we want to come back again to this place. This was our first time stay at a Residence Inn by Marriott and it will be our last.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE---CLEAN !!”
Reviews.Author: LSR53
Reviews.Content: Great location, Clean rooms.This was our 2nd stay and we loved the hotel and staff on our previous visit . This time we were unfortunate enough to be there with the cheerleaders and their "chaperones"? I use the word loosely ,because they were the most uncontrolled and unsupervised group of children I have ever seen.The adults with them were even worse, shouting and cursing at the staff. The employees did an AMAZING JOB keeping their emotions in check and staying on top of things in an absolutely awful situation!! They managed to keep all public areas clean and organized and the breakfast area was stocked and clean as well .FYI-- they have a really good breakfast buffet.! We would definitely stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY ROOMS/ POOL AND JUST TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: DND78
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom, 2 bath Suite for 4 nights. We paid $469/ night because it was a Race Weekend. Most of the hotels in Daytona are terrible but as fans of Marriott we thought our stay here would be better. But we were surprised at how terrible this place is. We asked for a view of the Race Track but the first night we stayed in a room overlooking the parking lot. This room was dirty. The maids obviously don't know how to vacuum, wipe things down or clean a shower. The shower shouldn't be covered in mildew! The front desk man, Bill, was very helpful and seems to be the only one that "works" there. He moved us to a 2nd room so we would have the track view that we asked for. After we moved our stuff to our new room, I went to the restroom to find that it had not been cleaned. The last occupant had peed all over the toilet. The shower had hair in it. The floor was covered in hair. And just like the last room the shower was covered in mildew. We found a maid down the hallway and she cleaned the room for us. She also commented that the hotel was having problems with getting the maids to clean the rooms. Addition problems in the room were the very loud fan in one of the restrooms. Filth under the beds (a used toothbrush, used kleenex and food). The AC did not work properly. Items missing from the room (toilet paper, dish soap, extra linens for the sofa bed). Window missing safety stopper. The pool was clean the first day we got there. But 2 days later it was filthy with bugs and debris. We told the front desk clerk, who had a maintenance worker come out to clean it. He walked down one side of the pool, barely cleaning it, then pulled the cleaning equipment out of the pool and left. We found him socializing with other hotel staff at the side of the hotel. The pool was never cleaned! We were told the breakfast buffet had been extended for the race weekend. But when we went down Saturday morning, they had stopped the buffet early. When we asked why they acted like they didn't know what we were talking about. Even though they had put out fliers on the front desk and they were still sitting there! The soda and juice machines ran out and the hotel failed to replenish them. Only providing a pitcher of water. When we checked out we walked by the laundry room and saw another disappointing site. The staff was folding towels and sheets and laying them on the floor. I guess that's why some of the towels in the room seems dirty! Don't stay here. It's not worth the money or the aggravation! You could stay at a roach motel at the beach for less and get the same experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Daytona 500 location”
Reviews.Author: bbland0
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. Good hot continental breakfast with grits, oatmeal, bisuits, sausage, eggs, cereals, danish, etc. Good selection of drinks and snacks at market. Full size fridge and kitchenette. Able to walk to racetrack, restaurants, and mall. Room by the pool was very noisy with guest that sat out there at night visiting. 15 minutes from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: jerrythetraveler
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that the Daytona Police had to keep visiting the Hotel due to a family reunion the Hotel was very nice. It is a newer property, I believe about 3 years old. The breakfast was decent and the property was well maintained. Many local dining options are available as well as shopping. The property is a short distance from both I-4 and I-95, as well as Daytona Beach. The hotel is essentially on the property of the Daytona International Speedway, easily a short walk. The suites are smaller than most Residence Inns I have stayed at, but the rooms are still larger than your traditional hotel room. All in all in a city full of less than great hotels this is a very good option at what I thought was a very ($111.00) great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: IndianaFoxy17
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience. Facilities clean and well kept. Best sleeping beds ever. Space of the suites was perfect for party of five people. Will definitely come back. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sthomas0616
Reviews.Content: My husband loves NASCAR so I promised him we'd check out the race course when we were in Florida therefore.....off we went (with my mom in tow) to this wonderful hotel - rooms are spacious, the kitchen is fantastic - I'd like one of those in my own house, bathroom is huge, breakfast was terrific, staff were very accomodating (we asked loads of questions and they were courteous and helpful) you cannot beat the location if you're going to a race - nice walk, right across the street - how can you beat that? My mother said she could see herself living there - that's how good it was! No downside to this stay - 100% right on in our books! Thanks Marriott for another wonderful stay in one of your inns.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: annie281
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn 5/30-6/1 in a 2B/2B suite. We were a family of four and this gave plenty of room. It was very clean and the staff was nice and helpful. The hotel is located right next to Daytona Speedway. Also convenient to many stores and dining options. A suggestion for a good place to eat...Our Deck Down Under. It is located under the bridge going to Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Overlooking Pool Noisy”
Reviews.Author: susanmurray
Reviews.Content: Recently I spent four nights in this Residence Inn and for the most part it was a good experience. The hotel was spotlessly clean and well appointed and the free breakfast was one of the best I have encountered. The staff was polite and helpful with the exception of one evening desk clerk. At first I had a room overlooking the swimming pool and the music was loud and annoying. I finally called down to the desk and asked what time they turned the music off and they said 11:00PM. I figured that was reasonable and I could read until then. When 11:20 came and went and the music was still on I called back and asked about it and the desk clerk said "oh, OK we'll turn it off ",in a tone that made me feel that I was personally responsible for breaking up his party. I looked out and there were only two or three people on the deck by the pool anyway. I suspect that there were far more than that who wanted to get to sleep. The next day I requested a room on the other side of the building not overlooking the pool and the request was quickly granted. It was a bit of a bother to have to pack everything up and move but the new room was very quiet and the rest of my stay was good. I would just suggest that anyone preferring sleep to listening to rock music at night request a room on the outside of the building not overlooking the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: crymik0123
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel. I travel a lot for my government job--meaning I stay in a lot of nice hotels. This one was very comfortable--spacious room, nice kitchen and bathroom area and a large, very comfortable bed. I felt very secure since all entrances required a room key to access. The complimentary breakfast also had a great selection.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient if not charming location, VERY comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwmariner
Reviews.Content: Immediately adjacent to Daytona International Speeday, Daytona Airport, Interstate 95, Volusia Mall, and a few short miles from the ocean beach, this hotel couldn't be more conveniently located. However, although it's very convenient, the location isn't very charming. But, what the hotel lacks there, it makes up for in just about every other way. The room I stayed in was large and felt very much like home. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The kitchen was well stocked with utensils and dishes and with an ice-maker, dishwasher, two burner stove, and granite countertops, it couldn't have been more inviting. The decor in the room was modern and welcoming. The large overstuffed chairs in the loby were seperated from the front desk by a dividing wall holding a very large flat-screen TV. This allowed me to really feel as though I was relaxing in my own living room (if I had way more money than I do), while waiting for my ride. The only thing wrong with this hotel was that it happened to be located in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ftpjtm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was flawless! The rooms were perfectly clean, everything worked perfectly, the bed mattress was fabulous, the staff was friendly, couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Superb accomodation - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jetstarboy
Reviews.Content: I often stay at Marriotts because you can rely on them, this one in Daytona Beach didnt disappoint. Hotel is less than 1 year old so everything is still sparkling as you would expect. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, breakfast is included and was plentiful - real value for your dollar. Staff were pleasant and friendly and the pool area was good - my daughter Jessica loved it. Overall i highly recommend this hotel and a big thank you to its staff for making our 4 nights memorable. If you have business at or near Daytona beach airport (DAB) then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott is the way to go!!! This Residence Inn is the BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: Passion4keys
Reviews.Content: I travel once a month with my job and we always go with marriott residence Inn or Marriott. This was my first time at this residence inn and it was great. The rooms were nice, the decor was very warm and contemporary. I will always return to Residence Inn Daytona anytime I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: collie40
Reviews.Content: went for race of course pepsi 500, stayed 4 nights,.. services was horrible, forgot tooth brush, night manager was rude and wasnt going to help us at all. No room service, cleaning ladys were loud every morning even after complaining, after long nights sleepin past 7am was important, they didnt see it that way. rooms were fine, but for the money ,super 8 in homestead was no worse..... we stayed at the new marriott it self, not the others, but this hotel isnt listed on site.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: FLClaudia
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our experience. All the staff, especially the kitchen staff, were courteous and helpful. The full breakfast buffet was outstanding, with eggs, sausage, biscuits, potatoes, pancakes, waffles, cereals, fruit, breads, juices, coffees, 3 types of milk, etc. The room was very comfortable and well-appointed. The kitchen was nicer than mine at home! Beautiful marble counters. We have a toddler, and the King suite had plenty of room in the bedroom to set up his playpen. We would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: cruiselyn
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but I wish it would have been a week and my husband thinks he could live there! The hotel is clean, staff are very accommodating amd the rooms are quite large and very nice. We had the two double beds room which seemed very large. I was very impressed with the whole room. The Swimming pool was large and fairly warm (a plus for us) and the whirlpool was hot. We greatly enjoyed both. Breakfast the next morning was great. Waffles, cereal, scrambled eggs, sausage, yogurt, etc. Lots of choices. I would return to this Residence Inn and will be looking for others when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service and Management”
Reviews.Author: Pat W
Reviews.Content: Now, this is a new Marriott property and the rooms are very nice but Daytona is seriously lacking in decent accommodations so I felt we couldn’t go wrong….WRONG! We booked 2 rooms for a 3-night stay for May 18th through May 21 for a graduation with family members coming from all parts of the county. As a Platinum member I booked my reservation through Marriott Rewards desk, but was paying for my stay and not using points. A few days later on Marriott’s web site I booked an additional room. The additional room had a request for an early arrival for May 19th at 1 PM. (yes, they have an option you check when making the reservation) So I now have a total of 3 rooms booked. I call 2 weeks before arrival and speak with a supervisor requesting all rooms be on the ground floor next to one another with a pool view. He tells me no problem and has blocked off those rooms for us. The property has several serious customer service and management problems. They can’t seem to get a reservation correct even when you call 2 weeks prior and request room location for 3 rooms together, speak with management who confirms the blocked rooms for your arrival. Upon arrival no one knows a thing and no one cares to help remedy the situation. Early check in request’s are not honored leaving guest to wait 2 hours after requested check in to get there room while maids clean other rooms instead of the room that the quest is waiting for. Plus, several other guests checking in had problems with their reservations including a couple who made a 2 night reservation but the hotel only had them for one night leaving them no room for the next night. After the disappointment of having to all be roomed apart we decide to get a drink from the nightly beer and wine cocktail reception and cookout that the Residence Inn’s are famous for. The front desk tells us there is no cookout, no bar and no cocktail reception. When I inquire as why since every other Residence Inn I have ever stayed at has them I am told that no Residence Inn has cocktail reception/cookout and if we want a drink we can WALK to the Marriott Courtyard down the street. This location is the closet hotel to the Daytona Speedway and I can’t imagine Nascar fans staying at a hotel without any place to have a drink. The next day at the pool I see 2 new covered unused BBQ grills by the pool. Hmmmm??? As Platinum awards member who spends over 75 nights a year at Marriott properties I decide to call the Marriott rewards desk and explain my treatment at this property. The lady I speak with apologizes and makes a phone call to the General Manager who is not on property at that moment but assures me she has left him a message and he will contact me as soon as he returns to the property. Well, for my entire stay I never heard from the General Manager or anyone else at this property. I doubt I will stay here again. Hopefully, Marriott will improve their service at this location.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn by Marriott Daytona Beach
HotelInfo.Address: 1725 Richard Petty Boulevard, Daytona Beach, FL 32114
